item.title: By: Erin-Kurley
item.dc:creator: Erin-Kurley
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/pretty-cheap-vol-1/#comment-85">Sarah Cosper</a>.
If you had paid for that blue mascara, Long's may have had just enough income to stay in business. So now you have THAT on your conscience.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Sarah Cosper.

If you had paid for that blue mascara, Long’s may have had just enough income to stay in business. So now you have THAT on your conscience.

item.title: By: Sarah Cosper
item.dc:creator: Sarah Cosper
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/pretty-cheap-vol-1/#comment-90">click</a>.
Thanks for sharing your experience with the mask! I mentioned something about it stinging and being careful if your skin is sensitive, but I'm going to add an update that lets people know about the issues you've had.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to click.

Thanks for sharing your experience with the mask! I mentioned something about it stinging and being careful if your skin is sensitive, but I’m going to add an update that lets people know about the issues you’ve had.

item.title: By: Samantha olivarez
item.dc:creator: Samantha olivarez
item.description: I just feel like I need to say that longs was the bomb and cvs is a poor substitute actually it really sucks in comparison .
item.content:encoded: I just feel like I need to say that longs was the bomb and cvs is a poor substitute actually it really sucks in comparison .

item.title: By: click
item.dc:creator: click
item.description:
Ooh, butter lipstick. I'm gonna get on that.
A note about Queen Helene's.. I have to say, I have sensitive skin, and it destroys me. When I was younger than 20, it was fine. Now that my skin is aging, it is asking for trouble. It dries me out way too much, it burns like hell, and leaves me with a thin, frail, red mess.
item.content:encoded:
Ooh, butter lipstick. I’m gonna get on that.

A note about Queen Helene’s.. I have to say, I have sensitive skin, and it destroys me. When I was younger than 20, it was fine. Now that my skin is aging, it is asking for trouble. It dries me out way too much, it burns like hell, and leaves me with a thin, frail, red mess.

item.title: By: JenW
item.dc:creator: JenW
item.description: That Long's Drugs reference really takes me back. That's exactly where I would go on my beauty product binges.
item.content:encoded: That Long’s Drugs reference really takes me back. That’s exactly where I would go on my beauty product binges.

item.title: By: Denys
item.dc:creator: Denys
item.description: Up and Up (Target's brand) has a make-up remover wipe that I like. I just bought a four pack (of 30 wipes/pack) for $9.99 ($2.50 a pack). It sounds like they do the same things as the one you are recommending - take off face and eye make-up, but struggle with eye liner and mascara. Anyway, just thought I'd throw that out there for those who are extra, EXTRA cheap and sexy.
item.content:encoded: Up and Up (Target’s brand) has a make-up remover wipe that I like. I just bought a four pack (of 30 wipes/pack) for $9.99 ($2.50 a pack). It sounds like they do the same things as the one you are recommending – take off face and eye make-up, but struggle with eye liner and mascara. Anyway, just thought I’d throw that out there for those who are extra, EXTRA cheap and sexy.

item.title: By: Sarah Cosper
item.dc:creator: Sarah Cosper
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/pretty-cheap-vol-1/#comment-83">Missy</a>.
Long's doesn't exist anymore! We beat the system!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Missy.

Long’s doesn’t exist anymore! We beat the system!

item.title: By: Missy
item.dc:creator: Missy
item.description:
Dude. The only thing I have ever shoplifted was a tube of bright blue mascara from Long's. I was 9 or 10. I still feel badly about it. Mostly because I risked my spotless criminal record for blue mascara (which I wasn't even allowed to wear!). This post speaks to my pre-adolescent heart.
There's a statute of limitations on that kind of stuff, right?
item.content:encoded:
Dude. The only thing I have ever shoplifted was a tube of bright blue mascara from Long’s. I was 9 or 10. I still feel badly about it. Mostly because I risked my spotless criminal record for blue mascara (which I wasn’t even allowed to wear!). This post speaks to my pre-adolescent heart.

There’s a statute of limitations on that kind of stuff, right?
